Description: Fragment of papyrus; Demotic literary text (previously unknown) involving narrative about an upset pharaoh; recto only. Padipep relates to Pharaoh the Story of the condemantion of Djed-hor. Same papyrus as EA 69531a-b.
Curator's comments: Published by John Tait 'Pa-di-pep tells Pharaoh the Story of the Condemnation of Djed-hor: Fragments of Demotic Narrative in the British Museum' . Enchoria 31 (2008/9|), 112-43.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (93265) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/93265)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: dirty, fractured, fragile, insect attack, loss, salt precipitate Black ink Supported overall: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass, board Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
